title: Ask HN: How do you build a real startup, and not a feature?
text:
A few times, I've eagerly shown something I've put together to people and they respond with enthusiasm. Then, as soon as I show it to some "seasoned" people (I don't know them too well, just strictly professionally) they tell me that I'm just building a feature.

This always stings me, because I end up shelving the project. I've done this a few times in the past, and years later I still don't see the type of product I'd put together in the wild.

Can someone with startup experience tell me what people actually mean by "don't build a feature"? Thanks

title: Ask HN: Evaluating if an idea's attractive because it appeals to your biases?
text:
I recently read a piece that painted a doomsday scenario for the near future. I found afterward I couldn't trust my cognitive evaluation ("believable, accurate, likely to happen") because my existing root-level emotional biases about "the way the world works" were influencing my mind's cognitive evaluation of the theory, making it more likely.

If you've seen ROBOCOP 2, I can kind of explain this more simply. In ROBOCOP 2, Murphy awoke to find that he had 200+ new instructions now each as important as his original three. His brain from moment to moment had to treat those instructions as 'true', cognitively.

Similarly, my brain seems to treat some of these emotional biases as automatically root-level 'true'. Murphy threw himself against a power grid to reset the problem. I'm not looking to get electroshock anytime soon.

I'm interested in mental habits, routines, or steps - either in the form of your anecdotes or of references to classic or modern approaches - that help you discern if your own root-level biases are causing you to misperceive or incorrectly evaluate a situation.

title: Atomico – Web Component framework in 3k of JavaScript
Is YC W23 in person or remote?
text: Looking at the YC application for W23, it says that the program will be fully remote (https://www.ycombinator.com/apply/). At the same time, we have an announcement that YC is back in person (https://www.ycombinator.com/blog/yc-is-back-in-person). Does anyone have any idea whether it will be one way or the other (or both)?

Ask HN: Anyone went into CS through an unconventional path?
text:
By unconventional I mean not a typical undergrad degree in computer science from some university. Mostly self taught.

Your definitions may vary a bit.

If you fit the criteria please share your unconventional path.

title: Is the West finally realizing that Russia will win the war in Ukraine?
Ask HN: How do you break up your day in WFH land?
text:
All the things they say on the internet are true about WFH. While massively helpful and it has truly allowed me to spend more time doing outside activities (like taking up Tennis), the monotony is fast setting in. I have tried moving locations, taking walking meetings, it just feels a lot of rote.

So HN - what do you do to break up your work day so every day is not a loop of the former?
